item.title: 8 Best Side-Scrolling Horror Games
item.description:
Summary

  • Side-scrolling horror games use limited perspective and great sound design for immersive gameplay experiences.
  • Different 2D horror games offer unique narratives and gameplay mechanics to explore.
  • Visuals, puzzles, and atmosphere in side-scrolling horror games create terrifying and enjoyable experiences.

Side-scrolling games cover a wide variety of styles and genres. Horror, specifically, utilizes this style of gameplay to its advantage due to the claustrophobic spaces, hiding mechanics, heart-pounding chase sequences, and fear of the unknown. Players are made to feel vulnerable with a limited perspective; being unable to see what's around the protagonist is certain to make any desensitized gamer feel even a little spooked.

Audio design is also a crucial element in this type of game, as it can make the player feel uneasy since it would be hard to tell which direction the sound of glass smashing or a creature's groaning is coming from. As such, these elements ensure that side-scrolling horror games are immersive, terrifying, and enjoyable.

8 Re:Turn - One Way Trip

Spooky Coming-Of-Age Tale Set On A Train

Saki and her friends go camping to celebrate graduation, unknowingly, for the last time. Jumping between the past and present, explore an abandoned train as Saki to discover where her friends have suddenly disappeared to. Switching between pixel art and digitally painted graphics, the visuals really add a spark to the proceedings.

Since it's primarily set in a single location, there's quite a bit of backtracking, so it can often feel a little tedious. However, the creepy atmosphere, chilling antagonists, and mysterious story make up for some lacking areas. If players enjoy simple puzzle mechanics and fetch quest gameplay, they will enjoy what the Re:Turn series has to offer.

7 The Coma: Recut

A Nightmarish Glance Into Korean School Culture

School-based Korean horror The Coma: Recut (2017) is a remastered version of The Coma: Cutting Class (2015) . Student Youngho falls asleep during the final exams at Sehwa High and finds himself trapped within the dark corridors of the school - no end seemingly in sight.

Whilst also being stalked by a killer, the player must help him navigate through this nightmare by picking up notes and talking to fellow classmates to unravel the mystery. With hand-illustrated visuals straight out of a manhwa and social commentary about the Korean school system, it offers a narrative worth playing.

6 Withering Rooms

A Souls-like Rogue-like In A Creepy Mansion

Explore the ever-changing Mostyn House - a Victorian mansion that houses a variety of enemies, including ghosts and witches that have their sights set on the protagonist. Players can tailor the gameplay however they like, by making use of stealth mechanics to avoid creatures or by fighting them head-on.

From rituals and crafting to melee combat, it's up to the player's decisions whether main character Nightingale will make it out alive or not. This one has a difficult learning curve to begin with, but an interesting and unique experience nonetheless.

5 Neverending Nightmares

A Frightening, Infinite Depiction Of Mental Health

Inspired by the developer's own struggles with depression and OCD, Neverending Nightmares follows Thomas who is trapped in a revolving door of horrifying dreams, not knowing when he'll wake up. In each nightmare, there are different ways Thomas can die - whether it's from a manifestation of a monster, or self-harm.

The black-and-white visuals really help to make the world seem empty, besides a pop of bright red to highlight the horror that Thomas is facing. With the reflection of the creator's struggles, it could be relatable to some players, making the fear factor much more realistic.

4 Detention

Trapped Students In 1960s Taiwan

Set at a Taiwanese school, explore Greenwood High as students Wei and Ray work together to uncover the mystery behind it, whilst avoiding spirits and other evil beings. As they are under strict martial law, combined with a desaturated color scheme, the world feels bleak and hopeless.

More focus is on solving puzzles and stealth instead of quick platforming, which helps ratchet up the horror. The characters hold their breath to walk past enemies, which makes it very tense with having restricted vision. Some of the visuals are quite eerie and will make anybody want to leave the school as quickly as possible.

3 Clock Tower: Rewind

Classic Point-And-Click Survival Horror Revived

Getting a fresh coat of paint with a remastered version of the 1995 classic Clock Tower , take on young orphan Jennifer as she explores the Barrows Mansion. For the first time ever, it's officially translated outside of Japan, bringing fear to a new, modern audience.

This 16-bit game provides stunning animated cutscenes, gore, and jump scares whilst puzzle-solving and avoiding the threat of the Scissorman. Jennifer is unable to fight back besides using traps, and players will have to keep an eye on her health and stamina, which can make it stressful for some. The remaster adds extra content and quality-of-life improvements, complete with a choice to play in its original or revised state.

2 Inside

Escaping A Disturbing Dystopian World

Set against an eerie, desaturated backdrop with only a hint of color, a young boy finds himself evading capture from the watchful eyes of those participating in mind control experimentation. Utilizing the environment whilst carefully making his way to freedom, Inside proves to be rather anxiety-inducing.

Alongside an ominous narrative and an unexpected hard-hitting ending, the use of platforming and puzzle-solving are an integral part of Inside , encouraging the player to think about their actions and to keep this young boy from just being another number in the system.

1 Little Nightmares

A Deeply Unnerving View Of Human Nature

Embodying a faceless child in a bright yellow raincoat, traverse a creaking ship-like vessel as protagonist Six to uncover the disturbing underbelly of human consumption, whilst examining themes between childhood and adulthood. Little Nightmares is as dark as it is captivating.

Dodge grotesque monsters using stealth mechanics or time jumps just right during a chase sequence to not get caught. Due to the size difference between the protagonist and the antagonists, the limited perspective is really abundant here, making the player feel more vulnerable and susceptible to the added tension, as it can sometimes be difficult to anticipate what the next step is.

item.title: Infinity Nikki - Photo Investigation: Faewish Sprite Group Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • How To Complete Photo Investigation: Faewish Sprite In Infinity Nikki
  • How To Complete Photo Investigation: Faewish Sprite Group In Infinity Nikki

In the Photo Investigation: Faewish Sprite Group quest, players are tasked with locating some Faewish Sprites for Alessandro in Infinity Nikki . Like many other Photo Investigation quests, this one is also short and quite easy to complete, but you do need to finish one before the Faewish Sprite Group to trigger it.

Photo Investigations are random quests that can be triggered by speaking with troubled villagers. They will likely say their problems out loud and the cause will be marked with blue writing. Normally, to complete a Photo Investigation quest in Infinity Nikki , Stylists must locate something hidden in the photo that is shown by the troubled character, like finding a missing Floof, for example.

How To Complete Photo Investigation: Faewish Sprite In Infinity Nikki

The only requirement to trigger the Photo Investigation: Faewish Sprite Group random quest is to complete Photo Investigation: Faewish Sprite . At first, Alessandro will be sitting at a house which is located northeast of the Stylist's Guild Front Gate Warp Spire. Talk to Alessandro to trigger the random quest in Infinity Nikki and find the three Faewish Sprites to complete it.

The Sprites are a bit hard to find as they are hidden in a bush of flowers which is almost the same color as them, thus acting as great camouflage. However, if you look closely, two are in the bushes while one is found far away near a tree . After completing the Photo Investigation: Faewish Sprite random quest, you can find Alessandro somewhere else to begin another quest.

How To Complete Photo Investigation: Faewish Sprite Group In Infinity Nikki

First, head to the Dream Warehouse Tower Warp Spire and go east to find Alessandro. He still needs help finding a couple of Faewish Spirits, but this time, he only has the group’s silhouette as a clue, which you need to match with the appropriate group in the photo. There are three rows full of Faewish Sprites and the group you are looking for is in the middle row and count three Sprites from the left to mark the middle one .

The key is to pay close attention to the details of the Faewish Sprites’ shadow, like how the one in the middle has a pointy hat and how its clothes are split into two strings at the back.

Once Nikki points out the group’s location in Infinity Nikki , Alessandro will thank players and end the Photo Investigation: Faewish Sprite Group random quest. Players are rewarded with 10 Diamonds and three Upgrade Packs.

item.title: The Sims 4: 25 Mods That Improve Child Gameplay
item.description:
Summary

  • Modders have enhanced child gameplay in The Sims 4, offering richer interactions, activities, and skills for children to enjoy.
  • Mods like First Love, PlumKidz, and Afterschool Activities Bundles improve family dynamics and add depth to childhood experiences.
  • Players can use various mods like Kids Can Paint, Foster Family, and Education System Bundle to explore new gameplay options in The Sims 4.

Children are a core part of The Sims 4 , yet the things that the player can do with them aren't as varied as one could think. The game has many strong points, but its long-time players have discovered that there are some aspects in which it could improve. For example, the children's school life and aspirations are limited to a certain degree.

Luckily, plenty of creative players have come up with mods that solve this problem and offer richer, more realistic child gameplay. From new school interactions to updated personality traits to a larger selection of hobbies, these mods help significantly improve child gameplay in The Sims 4 . Players who love the various stages of life but want this gameplay to be more fleshed-out can achieve the same, with the toddler and child stages being enhanced significantly with these child gameplay mods .

Updated on December 31, 2024, by Jenna Amore: Children in The Sims 4 often feel overlooked compared to teens and adults, but with the right mods, they can shine just as brightly. While expansion packs like Parenthood and Growing Together offer valuable additions, modders have stepped in to fill gaps and elevate the child experience even further. From interactive gameplay to skill-building activities, these mods breathe new life into childhood stages, giving young Sims more opportunities to grow, learn, and have fun. Here are the best mods to make child Sims more engaging, versatile, and central to Sims' lives.

1 First Love

Capture The Innocence Of Childhood Love

  • Created by LittleMsSam
  • Requires: XML Injector (Curseforge)
  • Download Here (Curseforge)

The First Love mod for The Sims 4 captures the innocent magic of childhood crushes, allowing players to explore the awkward yet endearing moments of young love. With this mod, child Sims can develop crushes on each other, performing adorable interactions like confessing their feelings, sending texts, or chatting over the phone.

As their crush deepens, a hidden romance bar begins to build, accompanied by custom moodlets reflecting their excitement and nerves. Share playful moments like monkeying around or heartfelt gestures like hugging and stargazing together. This mod allows players to define young love in their game, adding a new layer of emotional depth and realism to childhood experiences.

2 In Your Safe Piggy Banks

The Perfect Place To Safely Store Simoleons

  • Created by RAVASHEEN
  • Download Here (ravasheen)

This mod adds a charming yet functional twist to childhood finances in The Sims 4 . With the In Your Safe Piggy Banks mod, children can safely store the simoleons they've earned in their piggy bank, allowing them to deposit and withdraw money as they please. There's even a playful twist — Sims with the kleptomaniac or evil trait can steal from the piggy banks, adding a layer of mischief to family life.

This heinous act of betrayal can affect the relationship between the two Sims, introducing drama and consequences to the innocent act of saving. Introduce this mod to the game to add a fun and engaging element to childhood, blending financial responsibility with a touch of unpredictability.

3 PlumKidz

New Interactions, Activities, And Moodlets For Child Sims

  • Created by plumlace & plumbaleena
  • Requires: XML Injector (Curseforge)
  • Download Here (Patreon)

Creators plumlace and plumbaleena have teamed up to create the PlumKidz mod, bringing fresh activities to childhood gameplay in The Sims 4 . The mod introduces seven new social interactions for child Sims, such as "Start Sibling Rivalry," "Talk About Special Interest," and "Ask For Music Recommendation," adding depth to sibling relationships and friendships.

Additionally, parents can send their kids to one of six new rabbithole after-school activities, like Soccer Practice, the Ice Cream Shop, or the Trampoline Park. These activities lead to unique moodlet buffs, including the uncomfortable "Brain Freeze" and the angry "Sibling Rivalry." Child Sims can even experience emotion buffs like Cringe Parents or Jealousy, making family interactions more relatable and nuanced.

4 Youth, Family, And Friends Activities

New Rabbithole Activities For Family Bonding And Childhood Growth

  • Created by adeepindigo
  • Requires: Shared Library and General Pies Menus (itch.io)
  • Download Here (itch.io)

The Youth, Family, and Friends Activities mod introduces 40 new rabbithole activities for Sims of all ages, helping them create lasting memories with loved ones without requiring player control.

For child Sims, the mod offers 12 engaging options, such as classes, clubs, and entertainment activities like Art Class, Gymnastics, or School Dance, allowing them to explore their interests and bond with others. These activities enhance family dynamics and provide new ways for kids to grow and develop outside of the home.

5 Afterschool Activities Bundles

Classes, Teams, And Clubs For Children To Build Skills

  • Created by ilkavelle
  • Requires: XML Injector (Curseforge)
  • Download Bundle 1 Here (Patreon)
  • Download Bundle 2 Here (Patreon)

For more educational afterschool activities that allow Sims to build skills, download the Afterschool Activities Bundles . Creator ilkavelle has created a combined total of 11 afterschool activities between the two bundles. Artistically inclined children can take part in extracurricular activities like Literature & Poetry Class or School Orchestra, which can be found in the first bundle.

The second bundle has activities that are geared toward students who enjoy mental skills. Take an IT Course or Technical Classes, join the Nature or Science Club, or become a part of the Speech & Debate League. Children can build related skills by participating in their activities.

6 Kids Can Paint

Create Masterpieces From A Young Age

  • Created by Cepzid Creation
  • Download Here (Patreon)

The Sims 4 has several features that weren't available in previous titles. On the other hand, it's missing things that may seem surprising. For example, while children could paint in The Sims 3 , it's not possible in TS4. This is remedied with Cepzid's Kids Can Paint mod . Children have the same access to easel sizes and picture types as adult Sims.

Children can show off their painting skills and create custom artwork that their parents can sell or hang up. This is a great way to have kids help with earning money if simoleons are running low. It is a great way for children to practice their creativity, and players can live out their artsy child protégé storylines.

7 Kids Can Exercise

Fitness Fun For The Whole Family

  • Created by Cepzid Creation
  • Download Here (Patreon)

The Kids Can Exercise mod breaks down barriers and encourages young Sims to stay active and build healthy habits. With this mod, child Sims can hit the treadmill, punch it out on the punching bag, and follow along with workout videos alongside their family. It’s a fantastic way to add realism to Sims’ fitness routines while giving kids a productive and fun hobby that promotes wellness.

While heavy equipment like workout machines and rock-climbing walls remain restricted for safety, this mod still offers plenty of opportunities for children to join in on family fitness sessions. Storytellers with child Sims will enjoy the added depth this mod brings, whether raising a budding athlete or simply fostering a fit and healthy household.

8 Functional Toy Stove

Baking Dreams Begin Here

  • Created by Cepzid Creation
  • Download Here (Patreon)

Bring back the nostalgia of The Sims 3 with the Functional Toy Stove mod, now reimagined for The Sims 4 . This adorable addition allows child Sims to bake their own cupcakes, choosing from nine delightful flavors like vanilla, chocolate, and red velvet. Whether they succeed with a sweet treat or end up with a charred cupcake, this mod captures the charm of childhood experimentation.

The stove is available in eight fun colors and costs just 100 simoleons in build/buy mode, making it an affordable and engaging addition to any family home. Perfect for storytelling, this mod is ideal for young Sims who dream of a culinary career or simply enjoy indulging their inner pastry chef.

9 Functional Lemonade Stand And Table Bake Sale

Earn Spending Money As A Kid

  • Created by Cepzid Creation
  • Download Here (Patreon)

Children in The Sims 4 have limited after-school activities outside school clubs and the Scouts. They are also unable to get part-time jobs if players want them to have their own money. In reality, running lemonade stands or selling baked goods are things that kids do all the time.

With the Functional Lemonade Stand And Table Bake Sale mod, kids can tend a stand to sell lemonade or baked goods to Sims on the lot. The stand can be tended by either adults or children. Each stand has a list of flavors depending on what they sell. Children can run their own business and get some extra simoleons for the household.

10 Chores

Create A Chore Schedule

  • Created by LittleMsSam
  • Requires: The Sims 4: Parenthood
  • Download Here (Curseforge)

Children need a lot of time for learning, playing, and making friends but sometimes they have to do things they may not find as fun. Household chores are part of life regardless of age, but they are a good way to teach responsibility and help parents with some household tasks. Players with Parenthood can have their parent Sims tell their kids to do things like clean up, make the table, or do their homework.

Having to physically command Sims to do this every time can get tiresome, but the Chores mod reinforces children to do chores autonomously using a schedule. Sims can set a chore schedule using the Family Bulletin Board from Parenthood . They can assign cleaning duty hours or days ahead of time with the mod.

11 Child Life

Get More Children's Social Interactions

  • Created by JellyPaws
  • Download Here (Curseforge)

The interactions that a child has in The Sims 4 have increased quite a bit since the early days of the game when the toddler phase wasn't even a part of the game. EA has addressed many complaints with this game, but there are still many people who feel that children don't have enough interactions.

Thankfully, modders have picked up the slack and added their fair share of unique and custom interactions into the game to make it easier for players to enjoy this phase of a Sim's life. The Child Life mod does exactly that and allows players to help these children feel more lifelike and engaging, talking about stuff and engaging in activities that are appropriate for someone their age.

12 Homework Tweaks

Do Homework Faster

  • Created by Scarlet & LittleMsSam
  • Download Here (Curseforge)

Homework is a crucial part of any child's life, with these Sims needing to do well in school by completing their homework regularly and improving their grades. Failing to do so can lead to a poor graduation that doesn't really benefit a developing Sim in any way and can actively hamper their development in the long run.

Watching a child sit down and do homework for hours on end as their needs become critical is never fun, and players would ideally like a way to improve their time management by letting children do their homework faster and more efficiently. The Homework Tweaks mod achieves precisely this task, allowing children to focus their task on more fun activities that players can actually be invested in.

13 Kiddoddle Job Listings

Odd Jobs For Children

  • Created by ItsKatato and Adapted by adeepindigo
  • Requires The Sims 4: Island Living
  • Download Here (itch.io)

Childhood is a time for less work and more play, but every now and then kids want a chance to get some cash. Kiddoodle Job Listings is a career mod that allows child Sims to take on odd jobs. The odd jobs require the Island Living Expansion Pack to work properly because it uses the same system.

Odd jobs that kids can do include easy things like babysitting, dog walking, mowing lawns, phone repair, and more. The jobs available depend on the child's skills. There are also two versions of the mod: low pay rates for authenticity or high pay rates if players want their kids to bring in big bucks.

14 One Time Jobs For Children And Teens

Earn Money And Build Character

  • Created by ilkavelle
  • Requires: XML Injector (Curseforge)
  • Download Here (Patreon)

Help younger Sims earn their own pocket money with the One Time Jobs For Children And Teens mod. This mod introduces six "jobs" — dog walker, pet sitter, paper route, lemonade stand, yard work, and lawn mowing. Accessible from the computer under "Neighborhood Jobs," these tasks provide a fantastic way for kids and teens to earn extra simoleons without conflicting with school or afterschool activities.

Each job helps develop skills, character values, and motives, ensuring the experience is both rewarding and impactful. With added chance cards for every job, players can make meaningful decisions and spice up their Sims’ workdays. This mod is perfect for adding depth to family gameplay and crafting stories of young Sims learning responsibility and independence.

15 Allowance

Teens And Children Can Cash In On Allowance

  • Created by Scarlet & LittleMsSam
  • Download Here (Curseforge)

To get kids used to money management, some families might put into place an allowance system. This has been made possible in The Sims 4 thanks to the Allowance mod. Players can have the household family kids receive a weekly allowance of a specific amount.

Better yet, the allowance will be dependent on how well the child is doing at school and if they're showing good behavior. The allowance is stored in a separate money account, which further increases immersion for this mod.

16 Spend The Weekend With

Children Can Visit Their Relatives

  • Created by LittleMsSam
  • Requires: XML Injector (Curseforge)
  • Download Here (Curseforge)

Those playing a legacy challenge might like the idea of sending their household children out for the weekend to visit grandparents for instance. However, playing this out separately doesn't quite have the same effect, since it forces players to play out the weekend away as a child, which gets tedious.

The Spend Weekend With mod lets players simply summon a Sim to pick up children or pets from the household. They can then stay indefinitely and will be added to that household's roster until they are called to return. It's a great gameplay mod for children in The Sims 4 and players who want to focus on other household members for a bit.

17 Adult Skills For Kids

Children Can Learn More Skills

  • Created by PBHiccup
  • Download Here (Mod The Sims)

There are a ton of skills that kids on The Sims 4 simply don't have access to until they age up. This isn't realistic, however, since many of these "adult" skills like fishing are actually very doable for children to learn in real life.

The Adult Skills For Kids mod fixes this oversight in the game. This gameplay mod for children in The Sims 4 allows kids to access any adult skills, while also developing the unique child skills in the game. Excelling in skills such as writing, video gaming, and even robotics, are now completely possible for children, too.

18 Foster Family

Become A Foster Parent

  • Created by LittleMsSam
  • Requires: XML Injector (Curseforge)
  • Download Here (Curseforge)

One thing that's lackluster in The Sims 4 is the variety in the types of families players can have. Foster families are simply not a thing in the game unless players simulate it using the adoption system.

The Foster Family mod allows players to foster not just toddlers and children, but pets as well. It's a fantastic and immersive storytelling mod for family-focused players to play out foster family stories in a realistic manner.

19 Grow Up Aspiration

Parent Influence Will Affect Children

  • Created by jackboog21
  • Download Here (Mod The Sims)

A lot of people might not know what they want to focus on in their future when they're still children. That's why the aspirations for children in The Sims 4 can feel a bit narrow and limiting. They usually focus on developing one skill, such as artistic abilities or athleticism. This aspiration mod adds the custom Grow Up Aspiration , offering a new avenue to pursue.

If the player gives this aspiration to a child Sim, they will be asked to develop multiple skills instead of just a single one. What's more, they even get valuable aspiration points for doing their homework, which always comes in handy.

20 Spellcaster Child Can Use Magic

Children No Longer Have To Wait To Cast Spells

  • Created by Cepzid Creation
  • Download Here (Blogspot)

Players who love Harry Potter and want to have their own child wizard can do so with the Spellcaster Child Can Use Magic mod. Under normal circumstances, children can't use magic in the game, even when they're spellcasters just like their parents. They have to wait until their teen years, and only then can they start using magic.

This gameplay mod for children in The Sims 4 allows the children to use magic as well. They can't do every single thing that adult spellcasters are capable of, but the range of their powers is still wide enough to make for fun gameplay with the young wizards.

item.title: Genshin Impact: Mistakes Players Make When Using Mavuika
item.description:
Having a complicated building and combat system in Genshin Impact puts some players at risk of making mistakes. As each character requires a certain amount of stats to activate their passives, and dealing decent damage requires building your character with a small pool of artifacts or weapons, players are bound to make mistakes sometimes.

When looking into Mavuika’s mistakes, it’s hard for players to make mistakes when playing a character this good. Being this powerful in Genshin Impact , Mavuika covers mistakes with her extraordinary performance on the battlefield.

4 Giving Her Energy

Knowing how overpowered Mavuika’s Elemental Burst is, it’s only natural to build her to deal the most DMG through it. Some players might just stack as much Energy Recharge on her, or even pair her with a battery in Genshin Impact . However, Mavuika has a unique Elemental Burst that works with Fighting Spirit instead.

To collect Fighting Spirit and be able to cast Mavuika’s Elemental Burst more often, it's best to team her with characters from Natlan since they can activate their Nightsoul’s Blessing states. You can also cast her Elemental Skill more often as it also helps regenerate her Burst back. Lastly, Mavuika can also get some Fighting Spirit when another character deals DMG with their Normal attack, which is good when she’s operating as an off-field DPS in Genshin Impact .

3 Underestimating Her Tap Skill

Mavuika can deal a lot of DMG when using her Elemental Burst in Genshin Impact . You can even use the Pyro Archon as a main DPS while using the hold version of her Elemental Skill, which is the logical thing to do considering she needs to keep operating as a Pyro driver.

On the other hand, Mavuika also possesses a special ability with her Elemental Skill when you tap it. It will create a Ring of Searing Radiance that will follow the active character and deal off-field Pyro DMG to enemies. It works great when she’s operating as an off-field Sub-DPS because of how strong the hit is. Even if you’re planning to play Mavuika as a main DPS, you should always trigger the tap version of her Elemental Skill before you switch her out, since it’s a main source of energy to her unique Elemental Burst in Genshin Impact .

2 Losing Burst DMG

Having one of the strongest DPS in Genshin Impact comes with a price. You must fully understand Mavuika’s DMG and where it comes from or else her hits will start looking underwhelming. First, Mavuika can unleash her Elemental Burst as soon as her Fighting Spirit reaches 50% of her maximum capacity. Casting her Elemental Burst before reaching the maximum will severely affect her DPS since Mavuika heavily scales with Fighting Spirit points.

Additionally, when Mavuika enters the Crucible of Death and Life state, she gains new animations and scalings on her attacks. Prioritize spinning around with her Charged attack as it deals the most DMG in her kit. Using her Normal attack is still viable, but not as effective as her Charged attack.

1 Leveling Up Her Normal Attack

When building Mavuika in Genshin Impact , players should avoid leveling up her Normal attack since it only enhances the damage she deals when she swings her Claymore and not add anything to her roles.

Instead, to deal damage, players can cast Mavuika's Skill or Burst, where she'll get a new set of Normal attacks. This means that even though players are using Mavuika's Normal or Charged attacks, they don't scale with the Normal attack Talent.

However, to everyone’s surprise, instead of having three banners at one time, HoYoverse came up with a new system called the Chronicled Wish banner in Genshin Impact .

To better understand the new system of the Chronicled Wish banner in Genshin Impact , this article will cover some FAQ such as the mechanics of the new banner, the available characters, and the future plan for the brand-new rerun system.

What Is A Chronicled Wish In Genshin Impact?

The Chronicled Wish banner in Genshin Impact is like a mix of the typical Character Limited banner and Weapon banner. Here’s a summary of the wish system:

  • To pull on the Chronicled Wish banner, you must use Intertwined Fate .
  • You get to choose between the available character or weapon in the banner.
  • You’re guaranteed to get the character or weapon you want on the second 5-star pull . Meanwhile, on the first 5-star, the odds of getting what you want is 50% .
  • The 100% 5-star drop guarantee is at 90 pulls, regardless of whether you choose a weapon or character .
  • If you choose a character as your guaranteed drop, your 50/50 loss is going to be a character. Subsequently, if you choose a weapon, your 50/50 loss is going to be a weapon.

As a mix of Limited Character banner and Weapon banner, here’s how you can expect the Chronicled Wish banner in Genshin Impact to work:

  1. Choose between the available characters or weapons
  2. Wish until you get a 5-star drop
  3. There’s a 50% chance you will get the 5-star you chose. If you pick a character, your 50/50 loss will be a character, not a weapon; if you choose a weapon, your 50/50 loss will be a weapon, not a character.
  4. If you lose the 50/50, you will get one Fate point , similar to the Weapon banner. However, unlike on the Weapon banner, where you need three 5-stars for a guarantee, Chronicled Wish only needs two 5-stars for a guarantee. This means your next 5-star pull has a 100% chance of being the character or weapon you choose .
  5. Once you get the 5-star that you want or if you change your selection , the Fate point will be removed .

Does Chronicled Wish Pity Carry Over In Genshin Impact?

Similar to the Weapon banner in Genshin Impact , the wish count is carried normally, meaning the pity count will carry on, but Fate Points from the Chronicled Wish don’t get carried over .

An Example Of The Chronicled Wish System

For example, if you choose Shenhe as your 5-star guarantee, you won’t get any 5-star weapon from this banner . Upon using your Intertwined Fate, you finally get a 5-star. But instead of Shenhe, you get Ganyu .

Since you lost your 50% chance, you will get one Fate Point . Now, you can pull until you get another 5-star, and you’ll be guaranteed Shenhe on your next gold drop .

However, if you stop drawing and the Chronicled Wish banner ends , you will lose your Fate Point .

For instance, after getting Ganyu and losing your 50%, you pulled 50 times and ran out of Primogems. After the current Chronicled Wish banner ends and new characters are available, you’ll be back to the 50/50 odds upon choosing a new 5-star guarantee. However, you’ll still be at the 50th draw for your pity count and only need 40 more pulls to reach the 90th wish guarantee.

Is Chronicled Wish Permanent In Genshin Impact?

Genshin Impact 4.5 is the debut version of Chronicled Wish, but the second Chronicled Wish is long later in Genshin Impact 5.3. Therefore, it's easy to conclude that Chronicled Wish doesn't reoccur in every version and is something that's available from time to time instead.

Upon the release of the Chronicled Wish, it has the following criteria for the featured characters:

  • Only exclusive 5-star characters that have appeared in a Character Limited banner at least three times but haven’t been available in any recent Character Limited banner will appear in the Chronicled Wish banner.
  • Characters who appeared in the Chronicled Wish banner will still appear in future reruns or even other Chronicled Wish cycles .

However, the developer later decided to be less strict with the requirements so that they could bring long-awaited characters like Shenhe .
